pages.text: $(li)The Hourglass can be filled with multiple kind of Sand, Dust and Liquids.$(br)$(li)Once filled, the material inside will slowly start falling with a time depends of the material used.

$(li)Hourglass can be resetted by rotating twice with a $(l:patchouli:redstone/supplementaries/turn_table)Turn Table$(/l) or by shift clicking of it.$(br)$(li)You can recover the item placed in the Hourglass, right clicking on it.
$(li)You can place a $(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/comparator)$(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/comparator)Comparator$(/l)$(/l) next to a Hourglass.

$(li)The strong of this redstone signal depends of the remaining time of the Hourglass.$(br2)$(l)  Material time list$()$(br)$(li)$(l:patchouli:miscellaneous/vanilla/sugar)Sugar$(/l): 40 ticks $(li)Sand: 70 ticks $(li)Concrete: 105 ticks $(li)$(l:patchouli:miscellaneous/vanilla/glowstone_dust)Glowstone$(/l): 190 ticks $(li)$(l:patchouli:miscellaneous/vanilla/blaze_powder)Blaze Powder$(/l): 277 ticks  $(li)$(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/redstone)Redstone$(/l): 400 ticks $(li)$(l:patchouli:miscellaneous/vanilla/slimeball)Slime$(/l): 1750 ticks $(li)$(l:patchouli:tools/vanilla/honey_bottle)Honey$(/l) 2000 ticks
